value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to customize NoSQL data storage and distribution with the Azure portal, Cosmos DB extension, and Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

topItems.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

topItems.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
topItems.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

topItems.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
topItems.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory.

value.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data
value.excerpt: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data

value.title: Introduction to the Microsoft commercial marketplace
value.excerpt: Overview of the Microsoft commercial marketplace, including Microsoft AppSource, Azure Marketplace, offer types, and Marketplace Rewards

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Manage services with the Azure portal
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure cloud platform through the Azure portal, where you create and manage all of your Azure resources.

value.title: Azure Portal “How To” Series
value.excerpt: Welcome to our weekly series that highlights specific aspects of the Azure portal so you can be more efficient and productive while deploying your cloud workloads from the portal.

topItems.title: How to use pills to filter in the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: IIn this episode of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about the new design for pills, how to use them when filtering resources, and how to add and edit pill filters.  Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

topItems.title: How to get a visualization view of your resources | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to easily view a summary of your resources using different visualizations such as how to view all your resources on a map.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about built-in cost views in #Microsoft Azure Cost Management and how to create your own custom views. topItems.title: How to pin content to your Azure portal dashboard | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to pin content on the portal for easier access and monitoring. We'll go over how to choose a dashboard to pin to and the differences between a private and a shared dashboard.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com

value.title: Automate your workflow with GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Learn how GitHub Actions enables you to automate your software development cycle and deploy applications to Azure.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Automate development tasks by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create a basic GitHub Action and use that action in a workflow.

topItems.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create workflows that enable you to use Continuous Integration (CI) for your projects.

topItems.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
topItems.excerpt: Create two deployment workflows using GitHub Actions and Microsoft Azure.

value.title: AZ-400: Manage source control
value.excerpt: Use GitHub to build a modern source control strategy and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to move your existing project to GitHub from a legacy version control system.

topItems.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

topItems.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer
value.excerpt: This learning path guides data engineers through the evolving benefits your organization gains with Azure cloud data platform technologies.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Discover how data systems and roles are evolving and explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions using sample business cases.

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Explore the broad array of Azure technologies that analyze text or images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data.

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Build AI solutions with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Azure Machine Learning is a cloud platform for training, deploying, managing, and monitoring machine learning models. Learn how to use the Azure Machine Learning Python SDK to create enterprise-ready machine learning solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Azure Machine Learning SDK
topItems.excerpt: Azure Machine Learning provides a cloud-based platform for training, deploying, and managing machine learning models.

topItems.title: Train a machine learning model with Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to train a model and register it in a workspace.

topItems.title: Work with Data in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to work with datastores and datasets in Azure Machine Learning.

topItems.title: Work with Compute in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage compute contexts for experiments in Azure Machine Learning.

topItems.excerpt: Use a release approval in Azure Pipelines to help coordinate database schema changes between developers and database administrators.

topItems.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run Selenium UI tests, a form of functional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: One Dev Question on Azure

topItems.title: The relationship between an authorization request and tokens | One Dev Question: Hirsch Singhal
topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains how authorization requests are connected to access tokens and refresh tokens.    For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-v2-protocols?WT.mc_id=onedevquestion-c9-AzureIdent

topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Arturo Lucatero, a Senior Program Manager working on managed identities for Azure resources, explains the different types of managed identities in the Microsoft identity platform.   For more information, visit: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/role-based-access-control/rbac-and-directory-admin-roles

topItems.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Hirsch Singhal a Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the difference between identity, access, refresh, and session tokens. topItems.title: What types of Azure RBAC role definitions exist? | One Dev Question: Arturo Lucatero

value.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure
value.excerpt: Discover Azure's three approaches to deploying cloud resources -- public, private, and hybrid -- and learn the difference each makes in your Azure services.

value.title: Control Azure services with the CLI
value.excerpt: Learn the steps to install the Azure CLI locally, create a website, and manage Azure resources using the CLI.

value.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn to create an Azure virtual machine in minutes that can be used like a local physical desktop or server.

value.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Azure Functions allow you to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning server infrastructure

value.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.
